title: Crab and Shrimp Gumbo with Okra

Ingredients.6: 1 medium green bell pepper, finely chopped

Ingredients.10: 6 cups water, or more to taste

Ingredients.11: 1 teaspoon gumbo file powder, or to taste

Ingredients.12: 0.5 teaspoon Creole seasoning (such as Tony Chachere's®), or to taste

Ingredients.14: 0.25 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste

Ingredients.15: 0.25 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste

Ingredients.16: 2  bay leaves, or more to taste

Ingredients.17: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined

Directions.1: Heat 1/2 cup oil in a large stockpot over medium-low heat until a pinch of flour sprinkled into the oil just begins to bubble. Whisk in the flour to form a thick paste the consistency of cake frosting. Continue cooking, whisking constantly, until the flour is very dark brown and the color of melted chocolate, about 45 minutes.

Directions.2: Reduce heat to low and add okra, onion, celery, bell pepper, and garlic. Cook, stirring constantly, until onions are translucent and veggies are cooked, 6 to 8 minutes. Add diced tomatoes, cover, and bring to a simmer.

Directions.3: Meanwhile, heat 3 tablespoons oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add okra and cook, stirring constantly, until tender and no longer stringy or slimy, about 10 minutes. Add to simmering roux mixture and simmer over low heat, stirring frequently, 3 to 5 minutes.

Directions.4: Add 6 cups water plus file powder, Creole seasoning, salt, pepper, cayenne, and bay leaves. Cook, uncovered, tasting a few times as it cooks to adjust spices and adding more water if necessary, until gumbo is as thick as you would like, at least 2 to 3 hours. The longer it cooks, the better.

Directions.5: Stir in shrimp and crabmeat; cook for 15 more minutes. Ladle gumbo over hot rice in serving bowls.
